subtitle: This luscious layer not only looks stunning but is guaranteed to win anybody's heart over.

method.text: Place the strawberries in a bowl with the brandy and sugar. Leave to macerate for at least 1 hour.
Sprinkle the gelatine over the cold water and leave until absorbed. Heat the champagne gently in a saucepan for 2 min. Stir in the gelatine until dissolved. Leave to cool slightly.
Stir the macerated strawberries and any remaining liquid into the champagne mixture. Placing stemmed glasses at an angle, divide the mixture between them and leave to chill at an angle until set.

Meanwhile, for the strawberry layer, sprinkle remaining gelatine over the water and leave until absorbed. Place the remaining water and lemon juice in a saucepan. Sprinkle over the sugar and strawberries and simmer for 2-3 min until dissolved.
Stir in the gelatine mixture and simmer for about 1 min or until the gelatine has dissolved. Transfer to a food processor or blender and process until smooth.
Lightly whip the cream and vanilla until it forms soft peaks. Fold in the strawberry puree. Spoon on top of the champagne layer. Chill well in the fridge.
Decorate the layers with a sprig of fresh mint and a strawberry.

title: Champagne and strawberry layer
